definition: citadel/defensive city/acropolis
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
city walls/city/town/CL:座[zuo4],道[dao4],個|个[ge4]
the Acropolis (Athens)

sentences.english: On the top of the Acropolis is the Parthenon.
sentences.chinese: 衛城的頂端是怕臺農神廟。

sentences.english: And Rehoboam rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 羅波安與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: He died and was buried with his fathers in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 衆人將他葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: The first stop on most excursions is the Parthenon on the hill of the Acropolis.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數遊覽的第一站是在雅典衛城帕特農神廟山。

sentences.english: The Spartans withdrew their garrison from the Athenian Acropolis, and democracy was restored.
sentences.chinese: 斯巴達人從雅典衛城撤回駐軍，民主得以恢復。

sentences.english: From the top of the unexcavated acropolis, I had a bird's eye view of the whole city.
sentences.chinese: 我從還未開挖的衛城高處俯瞰這整座失落的城市。

sentences.english: The Acropolis is the focal point of Athens.
sentences.chinese: 雅典衛城的縮寫，是一種民主的象徵。

sentences.english: Then Jehoshaphat rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 約沙法與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: Ye have seen also the breaches of the city of David, that they are many: and ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool.
sentences.chinese: 你們看見大衛城的破口很多，便聚積下池的水。

sentences.english: Jehoram rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 約蘭與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: Ahaz rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 亞哈斯與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: Azariah rested with his fathers and was buried near them in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 亞撒利雅與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城他列祖的墳地裏。

sentences.english: Then David rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 大衛與他列祖同睡，葬在大衛城。

sentences.english: Liapis visited the site of the new Acropolis Museum Monday.
sentences.chinese: 利亞比斯星期一參觀了新建的衛城博物館。

sentences.english: On one occasion Ven. Ananda was staying near Savatthi in Jeta's Grove, Anathapindika's monastery.
sentences.chinese: 一時，尊者阿難住在舍衛城附近的祇樹給孤獨精舍。

sentences.english: Take a break at the museum's nice outdoor cafe before you trek up the Acropolis hill.
sentences.chinese: 在博物館室外咖啡廳休息一下，然後我們向衛城前行。

definition: Xianyou county in Putian 莆田[Pu2 tian2], Fujian
Lelang commandery (108 BC-313 AD), one of four Han dynasty commanderies in north Korea
Linzi district of Zibo city 淄博市[Zi1 bo2 shi4], Shandong
navy vessel/(coast guard) patrol boat
Dianji Temple in Keelung, Taiwan
Holy City
warship
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
night attack
to loot/to pillage/to sack
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
religious order
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
